configuration.name: Localhost
configuration.hint: Select the environment where you want to deploy Logz.io Telemetry Collector.

datasources.name: System
datasources.description: Logz.io Uses OpenTelemetry to monitor your computer.

params.name: envID
params.label: Environment Name
params.description: The name for your environments identifier, to easily identify the telemetry data for each environment.
params.hint: By typing an environment name, the name will be added as a label to the telemetry data of your environment.
params.patternError: Only letters, numbers, dashes and underscores are allowed

telemetries.hint: Switch the toggle on if you want Logz.io Telemetry Collector to collect logs from your computer.

params.name: logSources
params.label: Location of your logs
params.description: The paths of log files to collect.
params.hint: By adding paths, OpenTelemetry will read logs from these log paths and will export them to Logz.io.

params.name: isApplicationLog
params.label: Collect logs from Windows event logs application channel
params.hint: By checking this option, OpenTelemetry will collect logs from Windows event logs application channel.

params.name: isSecurityLog
params.label: Collect logs from Windows event logs security channel
params.hint: By checking this option, OpenTelemetry will collect logs from Windows event logs security channel.

params.name: isSystemLog
params.label: Collect logs from Windows event logs system channel
params.hint: By checking this option, OpenTelemetry will collect logs from windows event logs system channel.

telemetries.hint: Switch the toggle on if you want Logz.io Telemetry Collector to collect metrics from your computer.
